Title: GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio — September update
EnhancedContent:
The September 2025 update to Visual Studio brings game-changing Profiler and .NET Modernization agents, more powerful MCP interactions, and smarter code reviews.

### Highlights

Here’s what’s new with GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio 2022 (v17.14):

- **Profiler Agent**: Get started with Profiler Agent to find and fix performance issues more easily than ever before. `@Profiler`
in Copilot Chat provides AI-powered analysis to highlight bottlenecks, suggest fixes, and optimize benchmarks in a guided loop.
- **.NET Modernization Agent**: Upgrade your .NET projects to the latest versions and migrate them to Azure with the help of the .NET Modernization Agent. Right-click your project and select **Modernize** or prompt `@Modernize`
directly in Copilot Chat to get started.
- **Agent mode improvements**: Use agent mode more seamlessly thanks to faster response times, cleaner file management, and greater control. Agent mode is faster, smoother, and more stable with updates every month.
- **MCP prompts, resources, and sampling**: Leverage more powerful and customizable model interactions with MCP prompts, contextual resources, and agentic sampling.
- **Mermaid diagrams**: Visualize data structures and workflows by generating Mermaid diagrams with Copilot and clicking **Preview** to see the rendered diagrams directly in your Markdown editor.
- **Smarter code reviews**: Access more powerful local code reviews with advanced reasoning, more insightful comments, and support for custom instructions.

[Download Visual Studio](https://visualstudio.microsoft.com/thank-you-downloading-visual-studio/?sku=Community&channel=Release&version=VS2022&source=VSLandingPage&cid=2030&passive=false) to experience all the new Copilot features today. To learn more about what’s new, check out the [Visual Studio blog](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/visualstudio/visual-studio-september-update) and [release notes](https://learn.microsoft.com/visualstudio/releases/2022/release-notes?tabs=September).

### What’s next for Copilot in Visual Studio

Stay up to date on the latest Copilot features by following the [Visual Studio blog](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/visualstudio), where you’ll find roadmap updates and opportunities to share feedback.

For the latest news, release notes, videos, and community conversations, visit the [Visual Studio Hub](https://visualstudio.microsoft.com/hub/), your central resource for all things Visual Studio.
